title: Sans Serif from early 1900.
content:
Hi there.

I've been googling and searching but with not great results.  
I'm looking for some typefaces that were design in early 1900. Pref Sans Serif that looks great even today :)  
And if it was still a bit „fresh“ that would be even better. :)

So, a new typeface from early 1900. :)

It's to be used for a logo.
author: AnalogSystm

comments.content: [News Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/news-gothic/) (1908—1958), [ATF Franklin Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/atf-franklin-gothic/) (1904), or [Alternate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/atf/alternate-gothic/) (1903) by [Morris Fuller Benton](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Morris%20Fuller%20Benton) at the [American Type Founders](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/typophile.com/wiki/American%20Type%20Founders) and [Venus](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ftbauer/venus/) (1907—1927) which was designed at the [Bauersche Gießerei](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Bauersche%20Gie%C3%9Ferei) in Germany.
“ [1900s](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/1900s/)” tagged on MyFonts. _Not all designed then but certainly influenced._

Akzidenz Grotesk

or something quite new – Maple  
 [http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150217120851/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html")
Berthold's Block, Erik Spiekermann's Berliner Grotesk, Edward Johnston's Railway Type
